column4: Hi all. I was using ubuntu yesterday, and it went crazy on me. The dash and the sound, wifi, etc menu are gone. All i have left is the menu bar to the left and the desktop. Any way to fix that?
Let's start from scratch. What distribution are you using, did you had an update of your distribtuion recently?
So you are saying plain install, build from scratch, you didn't apply any recent updates, and noone has touched your OS nor your home directory yet, right?
Are you using Unity?

In case you don't use any specific settings, and login into the system then yes. But I am still puzzled bny your issue, since I still don't know what you are missing. A screenshot might help us understand the problem more

The Unity desktop looks like this in default this way... http://itmanagement.earthweb.com/img/2010/05/ubuntu-unity.png - How does your look? It might be just something you clicked on, and you cannot get it back...
So that's why a screenshot might shows us the current look more, so that's why I am already asking for that for the third time :)
Press Print-Screen, save file, upload to somewhere
There is only one user. So you mean just log off and back on?
Doesn't work. Check link again
Nope, didn't work either. It says: the listed page cannot be found. Are you sure you are trying to share with the right authority set for this directory?
If it fails, try imageshack.us or something other...
Now I see what you mean... Hmm, can be also caused by different issues. You might try to run gnome-appearance-properties and change the theme back to default.
how do i do that? :)
Alt+F2
Alt + F2 does nothing

That's an issue. Ok, let's approach this from a different way. Go inside console, Ctrl-Alt-F1, and "sudo su" to root. Then give a password for root (it shall be complicated), and then try to logon with root to GUI of Ubuntu.
Let's see if it's limited to the user you are using, or system-wide
done
Ok, close the terminal you were in, and go to main logon screen. Try to logon with root, and let it load
No. There is root too, just not listed by the Gnome Logon window after start. When it asks foir the user, click "logon with other", type root and the password
Hmm. Don't know, maybe it lacks some settings
But it more worries me why your settings went into the dumps. It might be also a sign of other problems
Unless Unity got updated while you were playing with some settings
